page.title: 02KELLIE CASTLE
page.content: The oldest part of the castle is believed to date from about 1360. The building mainly 16 and 17 century. Probably assumed its present dimension about 1606. Kellie is a very fine example of the domestic architecture of Lowland Scotland. Many of the internal fittings and features,e.g. the plastic work and panelling painted with "romantic" landscapes, are excellent examples of the period. The 'chief messuage' of the Seward or Siward family at the end of the 13 century. Kellie was resigned to the Oliphants with whom it remains for over 250 years before being sold in 1613 to Thomas Erskine, who became first Earl of Kellie. Virtually abandoned in the early 19 century. The castle was leased to, and restored by Professor James Lorimer.
